items.definition: any of various monocotyledonous often tufted marsh plants (as of the genera Juncus and Luzula of the family Juncaceae, the rush family) with cylindrical often hollow stems which are used in bottoming chairs and plaiting mats
calm, serious, and controlled behaviour that makes people respect you
a person who has experience and skill in fighting in a war, especially in the past
to become lighter or more colourful, or to make something become lighter or more colourful
to turn around and around quickly, or to make something do this
a period of staying awake to be with someone who is ill or to call public attention to something
the feeling of fear, especially if felt suddenly, or an experience of fear that happens suddenly
a path through a countryside, mountain, or forest area, often made or used for a particular purpose
an area of trees and bushes growing closely together
